name: HTTP Client
description:
Provides the ability to compose and execute HTTP requests from the code editor.

The following features are available:
  • Coding assistance with completion, highlighting, folding, and inline documentation
  • Live templates
  • Environment and in-place variables
  • Response handling API
  • Import from Postman Collections and from cURL
  • Send gRPC, WebSocket, and GraphQL requests in addition to regular HTTP
  • Support for OAuth 2.0 authorization: authenticate using the built-in browser, get access tokens, and preview auth logs
See the documentation for details.

Getting started

  1. Create a file with the .http or .rest extension.
  2. In the created file, use the Add Request editor shortcut link or compose the request manually.
  3. Click the Run button in the gutter to run the request and view the received response.
  4. Use the Examples editor shortcut link to explore the additional features and capabilities.
  5. Use the Open Log editor shortcut link to get an overview of the 50 recently executed requests and rerun any of them.
